laboratory_examinations.findings: Case 1 revealed a novel nucleotide substitution (c.151G/H11022A) resulting in a missense mutation (p.G51R). Case 2 revealed compound heterozygous mutations of c.142C/H11022T (p.R48C) and c.311G/H11022A (p.R104Q).
Case 1: Retinal degeneration with cystic changes; Case 2: Diffuse mild retinal degeneration with no pigmentation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: In Case 1, clumped pigmentation has appeared over a 23-year follow-up, and cystic changes in the foveal region became ambiguous.
During the 2-decade follow-up, retinal sensitivity decreased in Case 1, while Case 2's visual field was maintained relatively well.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Both cases showed nonrecordable rod responses and significantly prolonged flash ERGs.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: In Case 1, the amplitude of ERG was attenuated during the follow-up; Case 2 maintained relatively stable ERG findings despite advanced age.
